alert.note: Alert for Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 2:43AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia and south central Virginia, including the following counties, in central Virginia, Prince Edward. In south central Virginia, Lunenburg and Mecklenburg. * WHEN...Until 430 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 243 AM EDT, Runoff from heavy rain rain due to thunderstorms continues. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chase City, Lunenburg, Kells Corner, Rehoboth, Green Bay, Plantersville, Loves Mill, Finneywood, Blevins Corner, Fort Mitchell, Pleasant Grove, Wilburn, Fairview, Wightman, Arvins Store, North View, Rogers Corner, Gary, Oral Oaks and Spanish Grove. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
